business.headline: Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch cleared in probe: Government sourcesGovernment sources have indicated that investigations into Sebi Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch have concluded without findings against her or her family, with no actions planned.

Ambuja Cement acquires Orient Cements for Rs 8,100 crore. Details here Ambuja Cement aims to increase its cement production capacity to 100 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) by FY25, with the acquisition adding about 30 MTPA to its total.

Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders share price down nearly 9%. Know whyMazagon Dock Shipbuilders stock price: Shares of the company were trading 8.52% lower at Rs 4,268.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 12:39 pm.

Paytm share price plunges 7% despite Q2 profit growth. Here's whyPaytm share price today: The digital payment firm's share price plunged sharply despite the company posting a net profit in the second quarter of the ongoing financial year.

Paytm showcases strong growth in revenue, delivers profit of Rs 930 crore in Q2Paytm Q2 results: The quarter also witnessed a steady rise in revenue and contribution profit, reflecting the success of Paytm's strategy of scaling payments and expanding its financial services offerings.

Hyundai Motor makes weak D-Street debut. Hold for long-term gains or sell now?Hyundai Motor India stock market listing: A long-term ride to profits or time for investors to hit the brakes after its lacklustre debut?
Sensex, Nifty open marginally higher led by gains in bank and IT stocks The S&P BSE Sensex gained 153.24 points to 81,304.51, while the NIfty50 added 36.80 points to 24,817.90

Hyundai Motor India, India's biggest IPO, disappoints on stock market debut Hyundai share market listing: The IPO, which closed with an overall subscription of 2.37 times, saw tepid interest from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Hyundai IPO set for muted stock market debut on BSE, NSEHyundai India Share Price Listing: The IPO, which opened on October 15, faced a slow start, particularly from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Bitcoin prices surge past $69,000: What's driving the rally? Bitcoin touched $69,408.1 (roughly Rs 58,35,227) on international exchanges on Monday, marking a recovery after the cryptocurrency was in a price slump for the last three months.
Bajaj Housing Finance Q2 results: Net profit jumps 21% YoY to Rs 546 croreThe revenue from operations also saw a significant rise, with the company reporting Rs 2,410 crore for Q2FY25.

Health Insurer Niva Bupa gets Sebi nod for Rs 3,000 crore IPO. Details hereThe IPO, which the company filed for back in June, will consist of a mix of Rs 800 crore in fresh shares and an offer for sale (OFS) that includes Rs 320 crore from Bupa Singapore Holdings and Rs 1,880 crore from Fettle Tone LLP.
Sensex, Nifty fall as IT and metal stocks drag markets lowerThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 73.48 points to close at 81,151.27, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.95 points to end at 24,781.10.

Hyundai IPO GMP improves slightly ahead of market listing. What to expect?Hyundai stock market listing: The initial public offering, which opened on October 15, has seen a rollercoaster ride in terms of investor interest and grey market performance.

Manappuram Finance shares drop 5% today, 24% in 8 days: What's behind fall?The shares of Manappuram Finance hit a low of Rs 145.50, marking a decline of nearly 24% over the past eight trading sessions.

No GST on life and health insurance? Here's how it will impact youThis change, if implemented, could bring relief to policyholders and support the insurance sector by lowering the costs of these essential services.

Tata Consumer Products shares plunge over 7% today. Here's whyTata Consumer Products share price: At 1:27 pm, the stock was trading at Rs 1015.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down by 7.2%, as investors reacted to its muted performance.

RBL Bank shares crash 15% after Q2 results: What analysts are sayingRBL Bank share price: The private lender's shares plunged in intraday trading following the release of its Q2 FY25 earnings over the weekend.

Hyundai Motor India share price expectation: Check latest gmp before D-Street debut Hyundai Motor India IPO: The public issue opened on October 15, was initially met with hesitation from investors, but by the close on Thursday, October 17, 2024, it had been subscribed more than twice.
Explained: Why Kotak Mahindra Bank shares plunged 7% after Q2 resultsAt 1:02 pm, Kotak Mahindra Bank shares were down 5.18% to Rs 1,773 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch cleared in probe: Government sourcesGovernment sources have indicated that investigations into Sebi Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch have concluded without findings against her or her family, with no actions planned.

China confirms agreement with India to end border standoff in Ladakh: ReportBeijing said that it has reached a resolution with New Delhi on resolving the border conflict and will work to implement solutions.
Chaos at Waqf panel meet, Trinamool MP smashes bottle in anger, injures handTrinamool MP smashes bottle, injures himself during brawl at Waqf panel meet
Israel claims it found $500 million in gold, cash in Hassan Nasrallah's bunkerThe IDF said that it was monitoring the bunker but had no plans to strike it as it was constructed under a hospital.

Explained: Why were cricket, hockey dropped from Commonwealth Games 2026Glasgow Games organisers have reduced the number of sporting disciplines from 19 to 10. Among the major sports - cricket, hockey and shooting were cut - some of India's biggest medal prospects. Here's why the Commonwealth Games 2026 is having less number of events.

PM Modi arrives in Russia for Brics Summit, will meet Vladimir Putin today Live UpdatesBesides Russia's Vladimir Putin, the Prime Minister is likely to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping, as well as hold bilateral talks with leaders from the other Brics member nations.

I'm Kalaignar's grandson, won't apologise: Udhayanadhi Stalin on Sanatana rowUdhayanidhi Stalin refused to apologise for 'Sanatana Dharma' remarks, stating that the comments targeted its alleged repressive practices towards women.

Taslima Nasreen thanks Amit Shah day after SOS over residency permitExiled Bangladeshi author-activist Taslima Nasreen expressed her gratitude to Indian Home Minister Amit Shah day after seeking his help on renewing her residency permit. This comes amid concerns of rising extremism in Bangladesh after the fall of Sheikh Hasina's regime.

40 years on, Indira Gandhi's 'artificial unity' barb returns to bite CongressReflecting what Indira Gandhi said criticising the 'artificial unity' among opposition parties in 1984, the Congress is grappling with alliance challenges with INDIA bloc parties in Maharashtra and Jharkhand. The Congress is struggling to maintain cohesion within the bloc amid tensions over seat-sharing.

30 flights receive fresh threats, over 120 hoax calls in a weekSeveral Airlines have reported a series of fresh threats affecting 30 of its flights, mainly on international routes, this morning. The incidents, involving multiple hoax calls, have pushed the total number of such threats received by the airline this week to over 120.

Disengagement after we return to 2020 situation: Army Chief on India-China dealThe remarks come a day after India said it had reached an agreement with China to resume patrolling in disputed areas along the Line of Actual Control (LAC) in eastern Ladakh.

Woman claims Zomato delivery man 'abused' office staff, gets slammed insteadA Maharashtra woman was slammed after she claimed that a Zomato delivery agent verbally abused her office staff due to a delay of 10 minutes in collecting the order.

Salman Khan begins Sikandar shoot as scheduled amid death threats | ExclusiveActor Salman Khan has not delayed or postponed any shooting commitments so far. He has now begun shooting for Sikandar, as per the originally designed schedule by the team.

Why this 46 all-out will rankle India foreverThe pain of India's lowest first innings total at home is sharp enough, but when replays reveal the collapse wasn't due to exceptional bowling but rather poor judgement and reckless shots, it stings even more

Ahmedabad: Fake court busted inside real court, had 'settled' land disputeThe accused posed as a court-appointed official arbitrator and passed an order in a land dispute case in 2019. His fraud came to light when the same case came for hearing in the Ahmedbad City Court.

Bahraich violence: Supreme Court halts bulldozer action on accused for a dayThe Uttar Pradesh government has issued demolition notices to three people involved in communal violence in Bahraich over music being played during a religious procession.

Real or fake? How to identify the paneer in your plateZomato faced criticism after a Gurugram man claimed they sold 'fake paneer' via its B2B platform, Hyperpure. This highlighted a growing issue of paneer adulteration in India.

Khar Gymkhana revokes membership of Jemimah over father's 'religious activities' Khar Gymkhana in Mumbai has revoked Jemimah Rodrigues' membership after her father used the club for religious activities. The decision followed concerns over breach of club rules.

Why Ajit Pawar's NCP is BJP-Sena Mahayuti's weakest linkAs the Mahayuti of the BJP, Shiv Sena and the NCP combine their forces for the Maharashtra election, the Ajit Pawar-led party is being seen as its weakest link. From Pawar's graft-tainted image to the NCP's failure of getting votes transferred, several factors make it the faltering wheel of a three-wheeled autorickshaw.

Hyundai Motor India, India's biggest IPO, disappoints on stock market debut Hyundai share market listing: The IPO, which closed with an overall subscription of 2.37 times, saw tepid interest from retail investors, who subscribed to just 50% of their allotted shares.

Liam Payne had 'pink cocaine' in his system at time of death: Toxicology reportPost-mortem results indicated that Liam Payne was alone at the time of the fall and "was going through an episode of substance abuse", according to prosecutors.

9 seriously injured in blast at ordnance factory in JabalpurJabalpur Ordnance Factory Blast: According to information received by India Today, an aerial bomb exploded in the F6 section of the factory's building.

Brics Summit shows 'failure of Western efforts to isolate' Putin: ReportRussian officials already see the Brics Summit as a massive success. Vladimir Putin's foreign policy aide Yuri Ushakov said 36 countries confirmed participation, and more than 20 will send heads of state.

Woman who survived October 7 Hamas attack dies by suicide on 22nd birthdayShirel Golan survived the October 7, 2023 Hamas attack at the Supernova music festival in Israel. She was found dead at her home on her 22nd birthday.

Watch: Sunny Deol celebrates birthday with Randeep Hooda on Jaat setsSunny Deol celebrated his birthday on October 19 with co-star Randeep Hooda and the crew on the sets of his upcoming film Jaat. The actor also revealed his intense first look from the film, set for a Republic Day 2025 release.

Blackpink's Rose's retirement plan has no connection with musicBlackpink's Rose has a surprising retirement plan. The K-pop idol plans to do something unconventional after she has finally bid goodbye to her uber-successful music career.

Ranbir Kapoor, Katrina Kaif's Ajab Prem Ki Ghazab Kahani to re-release in theatres Ranbir Kapoor and Katrina Kaif's 2009 film Ajab Prem Ki Ghazab Kahani is set to be re-released in theatres. The romantic comedy was directed by Rajkumar Santoshi.

Salman Khan begins Sikandar shoot as scheduled amid death threats | ExclusiveActor Salman Khan has not delayed or postponed any shooting commitments so far. He has now begun shooting for Sikandar, as per the originally designed schedule by the team.

sports.headline: Explained: Why was Prithvi Shaw dropped from Mumbai's Ranji Trophy squadMumbai Cricket Association did not name Prithvi Shaw in their Ranji Trophy squad for the third-round match against Tripura. Prithvi struggled to get going in the first two matches of Mumbai in the season.

KL Rahul's form a concern for India? Assistant coach Ten Doeschate reactsIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate expressed confidence in KL Rahul's current form despite low scores in the Bengaluru Test. Rahul struggled in the Bengaluru Test and failed to make an impact with the bat.

Will Rishabh Pant play Pune Test? Assistant coach Doeschate provides updateIndia's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate shares optimism about Rishabh Pant's fitness for the upcoming Pune Test. Pant suffered a knee injury but is showing signs of recovery.

Cricket Association of Bengal faces heat after Ranji Trophy washoutThe Ranji Trophy match between Bengal and Bihar was abandoned without a ball bowled due to unplayable conditions following rain. The Cricket Association of Bengal faces criticism over ground management and preparation.

Tennis stars Fritz, Shapovalov slam new off-court coaching ruleWorld No.6 Taylor Fritz said the International Tennis Federation's (ITF) decision to allow off-court coaching from 2025 would ruin the one v one strategic and mental elements of the game.

Rishabh Pant always a bit of that X-factor in India's middle order: Pat CumminsAustralia captain Pat Cummins hails Rishabh Pant as the X-factor in India's middle-order for the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Polly Inglis earns maiden call-up as New Zealand women name squad for India ODIsPolly Inglis has been named in the New Zealand Women's squad for their India tour, marking her debut in a 15-member squad. The series serves as vital preparation for the upcoming ODI World Cup.

MI, KKR amongst five IPL franchises bidding for teams in The Hundred: ReportSeveral IPL franchises, including Mumbai Indians and Kolkata Knight Riders, have shown interest in acquiring teams in The Hundred, a tournament run by the ECB. The bidding process aims to finalise investors by 2025, with a potential hybrid ownership model being considered.

Smith out for 0, Marnus bowls medium pace as AUS prep for India TestsSenior Australia batter continued to have poor fortunes in Sheffield Shield in the build-up to the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Batting against Victoria Smith scored 3 and 0 in two innings. On the other hand, Marnus Labuschagne was spotted bowling medium-pace.

Clement Lenglet joins Atletico Madrid injury list ahead of Lille tieAtletico Madrid faces a major setback as Clément Lenglet joins the injury list ahead of their Champions League match against Lille. With key players already out, Simeone's squad faces a tough challenge.

Michael Clarke backs Bancroft to open for Australia in Test series vs IndiaFormer Australian captain Michael Clarke backs Cameron Bancroft's return to the Test team, advocating for his selection as an opener against India. Clarke highlights Bancroft's consistent domestic performance as a key factor.

Virgil van Dijk to extend contract at Liverpool: Discussions are ongoingLiverpool captain Virgil van Dijk has said formal discussions over a contract extension have begun at the Premier League club. The defender's current contract is set to expire this season.

Mentality not enough to beat Real Madrid: Borussia Dortmund coach SahinBorussia Dortmund's head coach Nuri Sahin warns his team about the challenges of facing Real Madrid in the Champions League. Emphasizing a complete performance, Sahin reflects on his personal connection to the Bernabéu.

Jay Shah's entry to alter ICC rules? Board recommends changesThe International Cricket Council has recommended changes in the chief's tenure. The move comes right before Jay Shah is set to take over the cricket body.

New Zealand star Kane Williamson to miss second Test against IndiaIndia vs New Zealand, Pune Test: New Zealand have revealed key batter Kane Williamson will miss the second Test against India due to injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
